text: Je (Ј, ј) is a letter of the Cyrillic alphabet, used in the Serbian, Macedonian, Azeri, and Altai languages. In Serbian, Macedonian and Azeri this letter sounds like [y]. Since the letters Я (ya), Є (ye), Ё (yo), Ї (yi) and Ю (yu) are not used in those languages, they are written as Ja, Je, Jo, Jи and Jy. It is also used in the Altai language to show [ʤ] or [j]. In Russian, Bulgarian, Ukrainian and Belarusian languages, Й is used instead of Ј. ==Related pages== *J
title: Je (Cyrillic)
